home.title: Welcome to Civil Calculation World
home.description: Your professional toolkit for accurate building-material quantity and structural reinforcement specifications. All data is processed locally, ensuring privacy and offline capability.

calculators.title: Calculators
calculators.description: Access a comprehensive suite of calculators for columns, beams, slabs, foundations, and more. Each tool is designed for precision and adherence to code standards.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Organize your calculations into projects. Save, retrieve, and manage all structural element data for a complete project overview and material takeoff.

reports.title: Reports
reports.description: Generate detailed reports from your project data. Create material schedules, reinforcement lists, and summary documents for submission and review.

calculators.pageSubtitle: Select a structural element to begin calculations.

rect.title: Rectangular/Square Column
rect.description: Calculate materials for rectangular or square columns with tied reinforcement.

circ.title: Circular Column
circ.description: Calculate materials for circular columns with tied or spiral reinforcement.

other.title: Other Column Shapes
other.description: Calculators for L-shaped, T-shaped, or composite columns coming soon.

rect.title: Rectangular Beam
rect.description: Calculate materials for standard rectangular beams with top and bottom reinforcement.

t.title: T-Beam
t.description: Calculate materials for T-beams, accounting for effective flange width.

cantilever.title: Cantilever Beam
cantilever.description: Calculator for cantilever beams and their specific reinforcement needs coming soon.

oneway.title: One-Way Slab
oneway.description: Calculate materials for slabs supported on two sides, with main and distribution steel.

twoway.title: Two-Way Slab
twoway.description: Calculate materials for slabs supported on four sides, reinforced in two directions.

flat.title: Flat Slab / Waffle Slab
flat.description: Advanced slab system calculators including drop panels and waffle slabs are coming soon.

iso.title: Isolated Footing
iso.description: Calculate materials for single-column isolated pad footings.

comb.title: Combined Footing
comb.description: Calculate materials for footings supporting two or more columns.

strip.title: Strip Footing
strip.description: Calculate materials for continuous footings supporting a load-bearing wall.

mat.title: Mat/Raft Foundation
mat.description: Calculator for large mat or raft foundations is under development.

pile.title: Pile Cap Foundation
pile.description: Calculate materials for a pile cap transferring column loads to a group of piles.

rect.title: Rectangular Wall
rect.description: Calculate materials for standard structural or non-structural walls.

retaining.title: Retaining Wall
retaining.description: Perform stability checks and calculate materials for cantilever retaining walls.

circ.title: Circular Wall
circ.description: Calculator for circular walls, such as tanks or silos, coming soon.

shear.title: Shear Wall
shear.description: Detailed shear wall design calculator, including boundary elements, is planned.

diaphragm.title: Floor & Roof Diaphragms
diaphragm.description: Calculate reinforcement for chords, collectors, and shrinkage in diaphragms.

corbel.title: Bracket & Corbel Design
corbel.description: Calculate required reinforcement for brackets and corbels using strut-and-tie.

beamCol.title: Beam-Column Joint
beamCol.description: Check shear strength and basic detailing for beam-column joints.

anchorage.title: Anchorage to Concrete
anchorage.description: Check anchorage capacity based on ACI 318 provisions for concrete breakout.

inputs.loadsAnalysisHint: This section is for informational purposes. Load calculation is not yet implemented.

placeholder.inDevelopment: This calculator is currently in development and will be available in a future update.

alerts.noDataToExport: There is no project data to export.

errors.avdRatio: av/d ratio must be <= 1.0 for this method.
errors.calculationFailed: Calculation failed. Please check your inputs and try again.
errors.flangeWiderThanWeb: Flange width must be greater than or equal to web width.
errors.flangeThickerThanDepth: Flange thickness cannot be greater than the total beam depth.
errors.minSpiralBars: Minimum 6 bars required for spiral reinforcement.
errors.spiralPitchRange: ACI requires spiral pitch between 25mm (1 in) and 75mm (3 in).
errors.stemTaper: Top thickness cannot be greater than bottom thickness.
errors.pileConfig: Pile configuration dimensions do not fit within the cap dimensions.

projects.pageSubtitle: Manage and review all your saved calculations for the current project.
projects.noCalculationsHint: Start by using a calculator and adding the results to your project.

reports.noDataSubtitle: Save some calculations to your project to generate reports.
reports.footerDisclaimer: This calculation sheet is for estimation and preliminary design purposes. All calculations should be verified by a qualified professional engineer.

charts.title: Project Data Visualization
charts.concreteTitle: Concrete Volume Distribution by Element Type
charts.steelTitle: Steel Weight Distribution by Bar Size

placeholders.confinementNotes: e.g., confinement required at beam-column joint

tooltips.developmentLength: ACI 318-19, Cl 25.4 specifies the calculation for the development length of reinforcement, which is the minimum length required to anchor a bar in concrete.
tooltips.tieSpacing: ACI 318-19, Cl 25.7.2 specifies maximum spacing for transverse reinforcement (ties) in columns to ensure confinement and prevent buckling of longitudinal bars.
tooltips.stirrupSpacing: ACI 318-19, Cl 9.7.6.2 specifies maximum spacing for shear reinforcement (stirrups) in beams, typically the lesser of d/2 or 600mm (24 in).
tooltips.minClearSpacing: ACI 318-19, Cl 25.2 requires a minimum clear spacing between parallel bars to ensure proper concrete consolidation. This is typically the greater of the bar diameter, 25mm (1 in), or (4/3) * max aggregate size.
tooltips.concreteCover: ACI 318-19, Table 20.5.1.3.1 specifies minimum concrete cover for protection of reinforcement against corrosion and fire, based on exposure conditions and member type.
tooltips.soilBearingPressure: The allowable soil bearing pressure is a key geotechnical parameter obtained from a soil investigation report. It represents the maximum pressure the soil can safely support.
tooltips.soilFrictionAngle: The internal friction angle (Ï) of soil is a measure of its shear strength. It is a critical parameter for calculating lateral earth pressure and retaining wall stability.
tooltips.surchargeLoad: Uniform load on soil surface behind the wall.
tooltips.embedmentDepth: Effective embedment depth (hef) is critical for anchor capacity. ACI 318-19, Chapter 17 provides requirements to prevent concrete breakout failure.
tooltips.edgeDistance: Minimum concrete edge distance (ca1) is required to prevent side-face blowout and pryout failure for anchors loaded in shear, as specified in ACI 318-19, Chapter 17.
tooltips.capEdgeDistance: The distance from the center of the outermost pile to the edge of the pile cap.

aiAssistant.title: AI Assistant
aiAssistant.description: Describe the column parameters in natural language. The AI will parse your text and pre-fill the form.
aiAssistant.placeholderRectColumn: e.g., a 450 by 600 mm column that is 3.5 meters tall with 10 rebars
aiAssistant.placeholderCircColumn: e.g., a circular column with a 500mm diameter, 3m high, with 6 bars
aiAssistant.failure: Could not get a valid response from the AI. Please check your prompt or API key and try again.

help.pageSubtitle: Find answers to common questions about Civil Calculation World, or ask our AI assistant.

assistant.title: AI Help Assistant
assistant.placeholder: Ask a short question about the app or civil engineering...

faqs.question: Is my data private?
faqs.answer: Yes. All data, including your saved projects and calculations, is stored exclusively in your browser's local storage. No information is ever sent to a server. This ensures complete privacy and allows the app to work fully offline.

faqs.question: How do I switch between Metric and Imperial units?
faqs.answer: You can change the default unit system at any time by clicking the Settings icon in the top-right corner. The new unit system will be applied as the default for all new calculations. Note that individual inputs within a calculator can also have their units changed on-the-fly.

faqs.question: How do I save a calculation?
faqs.answer: After performing a calculation, the results panel will appear. Click the 'Add to Project' button. You will be prompted to enter a unique description for the calculation (e.g., 'Ground Floor Column C1'). Once saved, it will appear on the 'Projects' page.

faqs.question: Can I share my project with a colleague?
faqs.answer: Yes. Go to the 'Projects' page and click the 'Export Project' button. This will download a single JSON file containing all your saved calculations. You can send this file to a colleague, who can then use the 'Import Project' button on their instance of the app to load your entire project.

disclaimer.title: Code Basis & Disclaimer
disclaimer.codeVersion: All structural calculations and design checks within this application are based on the principles outlined in **ACI 318-19 (Building Code Requirements for Structural Concrete)** unless otherwise noted.
disclaimer.purpose: This application is intended for **preliminary design and educational purposes only**. It serves as a tool for quick estimation and verification of member sizes and material quantities.
disclaimer.verification: **All results must be independently verified and approved by a qualified professional engineer** before being used for construction or any other official purpose. The developers assume no liability for the use or interpretation of the results provided.
